release.action: Fixed PICO-43 - Make DefaultComponentAdapter compile under JDK 1.3.
Fixed PICO-44 - Lack of information when pico is unable to satisfy dependencies.
Fixed PICO-47 - Avoid StackOverflowError when dependency cycle exists. (CyclicDependencyException with a detailed message will be thrown instead)
Fixed PICO-49 - Change registerComponentInstance to be more flexible.
Fixed PICO-50 - Upgrade CVSSGrab.
Fixed PICO-55 - Use PicoContainer as a factory of transient (unmanaged) objects.

Big refactoring making the API simpler. This was needed because there was no clear separation of concerns between the old ComponentRegistry and PicoContainer interfaces (and the implementing classes). This led to a lot of confusion and offered too many ways to do things. The API is now less ambiguous, and there is no "expert" or "normal" ways to use PicoContainer. One interface, one way.
CompositePicoContainer and HierarchicalComponentRegistry were replaced by DelegatingPicoContainer.
Removed ComponentRegistry by merging it with PicoContainer.
All exceptions are now RuntimeExceptions.
Added an Ant task for PicoContainer (It currently lives in the NanoContainer codebase).
Fixed PICO-6 - Lazy instantiation of components. As a result, PicoContainer.instantiateComponents() is removed, and PicoContainer.getComponent(Object key) throw PicoInitialisationException.
Fixed PICO-39 - Support multiple constructors.
Fixed PICO-41 - Removed static "constructor" subclasses.
Added unregistration for components.
Moved loads of classes. Simplified package structure. In prep for release.
CompositePicoContainer changed to take ComponentRegistry and no longer extend DefaultPicoContainer.
HierarchicalPicoContainer obsoleted for sake of HierarchicalComponentRegistry
Moved findxxx methods from DefaultPicoContainer to ComponentRegistry
ComponentRegistry refactored out of DefaultPicoContainer
Changed nethod signatures from Object[] to java.util.Collection.
Renamed AggregateProxyFactory to CompositeProxyFactory.
Changed signatures on PicoContainer from registerComponent to more verbose method names.
Fixed PICO-20 - Merge default lifecycle interfaces into one.
Fixed PICO-21 - Change package name from picocontainer to org.picocontainer.
Fixed PICO-23 - Nuke BeanStyleComponentFactory.
Fixed PICO-28 - Merge PicoInstantiationException and PicoIntrospectionException.
Fixed PICO-29 - Rename AggregatedContainersContainer to CompositePicoContainer.
Fixed PICO-31 - Make getAggregateComponentProxy() an interface method on PicoContainer.
Fixed PICO-32 - Support multiple implementations of same service.
Factored out logic for creation of aggregating proxy for a container's components. This opens up for alternative implementations using e.g. cglib.
Factored out default dependency-handling algorithms into pluggable Parameter-strategies. This opens up for multiple implementations, parameters configured from properties-files and so on.
Refactored the ComponentFactory interface so that IoC type 3 (based on constructors) is no longer mandatory.
A Bean-style component factory is provided for components implemented as Java Beans. (Empty constructors and setXxx methods taking one argument).
ImplementationHindingComponentFactory is now a decorator rather than a subclsss of the default one, making it usable in conjunction with any other ComponentFactory.
Improved the getAggregateComponentProxy method so that when a method is called on the proxy, the returned value will also be a proxy that aggregates.

Added optional lifecycle interfaces and LifecyclePicoContainer in org.picocontainer.lifecycle. This package is optional, and can be used as inspiration for implementation of other containers that handle lifecycle transparently with extra methods on the container.
First release.
